BikeSack

Class TextualInstrument

  • java.lang.Object
    • BikeSack.Instrument
      • BikeSack.TextualInstrument
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    UsageInstrument

    public class TextualInstrument
extends Instrument
    Provides an Instrument which as oriented around displaying text.
    See Also:
    Instrument

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String FORMAT_DOUBLE
      The string format to return when the current value of the TextualInstrument is not an integer (that is; multiplier is not 1)
      static java.lang.String FORMAT_INTEGER
      The string format to return when the current value of the TextualInstrument is an integer (that is; multiplier is 1)
      private int multiplier
      The difference between the current value and the unit value.
      private java.lang.String unit
      The unit to be displayed after the current TextualInstrument value

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TextualInstrument(int current)
      Create a TextualInstrument with no unit and a multiplier of 1
      TextualInstrument(int current, int multiplier, java.lang.String unit)
      Create a TextualInstrument with a unit and a custom multiplier
      TextualInstrument(int current, java.lang.String unit)
      Create a TextualInstrument with a unit and a multiplier of 1

      Return a String representation of this TextualInstrument in the format supplied.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Convert the TextualInstrument to a String with the current value, divided by the multiplier, followed by the unit.

    • Field Detail

      • FORMAT_INTEGER

        public static final java.lang.String FORMAT_INTEGER
        The string format to return when the current value of the TextualInstrument is an integer (that is; multiplier is 1)
        See Also:
        Instrument.current, multiplier, Constant Field Values

      • FORMAT_DOUBLE

        public static final java.lang.String FORMAT_DOUBLE
        The string format to return when the current value of the TextualInstrument is not an integer (that is; multiplier is not 1)
        See Also:
        Instrument.current, multiplier, Constant Field Values

      • unit

        private java.lang.String unit
        The unit to be displayed after the current TextualInstrument value
        See Also:
        Instrument.current

      • multiplier

        private int multiplier
        The difference between the current value and the unit value. For example if current is stored in millimeters and the unit is kilometers, the multiplier would be 1000000
        See Also:
        Instrument.current, unit

        public TextualInstrument(int current,
                         int multiplier,
                         java.lang.String unit)
        Create a TextualInstrument with a unit and a custom multiplier
        Parameters:

        multiplier - The difference between the current value and the unit value.
        unit - The unit to be displayed after the current TextualInstrument value
        See Also:
        unit, multiplier

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Convert the TextualInstrument to a String with the current value, divided by the multiplier, followed by the unit. Example output if current=1200000, multiplier=1000000, and unit="Km": "1.2Km"
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A string of format FORMAT_INTEGER or FORMAT_DOUBLE
        See Also:
        FORMAT_INTEGER, FORMAT_DOUBLE, Instrument.current, multiplier, unit, Object.toString()

      • toFormattedString

        public java.lang.String toFormattedString(java.lang.String format)
        Return a String representation of this TextualInstrument in the format supplied. Arguments passed to the String.format are (current / multiplier) and unit
        Parameters:
        format - The String.format format string
        Returns:
        A formatted string of format format
        See Also:
        Instrument.current, multiplier, unit
